name: market for trawler maintenance, steel | trawler maintenance, steel | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17526/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'trawler maintenance, steel', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This item is delivering the service of 'trawler maintenance, steel'. A trawler is a fishing vessel designed to use trawl nets in order to catch large volumes of fish. The dataset represents the maintenance of steel trawlers per 1000 kg of light ship weight, corresponding to 9 vessels. The service includes materials input, production infrastructure, emissions and end-of-life. 

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

exchanges.description: Maintenance of a trawler, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW) over 35 years lifetime. Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW, adjusted for trawler's gear. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication.
